creditline: Gift of Ellen and Fred Wells
inscription: 近江八景の内　粟津　大正六年五月 {Ōmi hakkei no uchi Awazu, Taishō rokunen gogatsu} (The Eight Views of Lake Biwa, Awazu, May 1917)
markings: on back, red seal: 伊藤深水画　近江八景粟津　摺刷二百枚限の内　第四十六番 {Itō Shinsui ga, Ōmi hakkei Awazu shūsatsu nihyaku mai kagiri no uchi, dai yonjūroku ban} (picture by Itō Shinsui, Eight Views of Lake Biwa, Awazu, printed edition of 200, number 46); red square publisher seals: 版元 {hanmoto} (publisher), ワタナベ {Watanabe}
medium: Woodblock print, ink and color on paper
portfolio: The Eight Views of Lake Biwa (Ōmi hakkei no uchi 近江八景の内)
text: Ito_ Shinsui submitted his first landscape series, <i>The Eight Views of Lake Biwa, <i> to an exhibition in June of 1918. Seeing these images triggered Kawase Hasui’s interest in designing prints, and he approached Shinsui’s publisher, Watanabe Sho_zaburo_, with some landscape sketches of his own.
title: Awazu
